concept.title: Preparing Applications for Usage in a SaaS Model

section.p: An application that is to be offered in a SaaS model should take the following aspects into consideration:

ul.li: A remote interface by which users can access the application from anywhere in the Web (Internet/Intranet). This may be, for example, a Web user interface or a Web service.
Multi-tenancy at least with respect to the management of data:
High scalability, because the number of users, performance, and space requirements may differ to a great extent for each customer.
High availability, ideally 24x7. It is usually required to host an application in a professional data center that takes care of non-stop operation, backup, data security, and regular maintenance.

Security aspects such as the following: Web service calls between and an application can be sent as plain text containing a user ID and password. For secure communication, the usage of certificates is recommended.

section.p: Technology providers may have to adapt their applications to fulfill these recommendations. They do this in their own development environments using their own tools and facilities.
